Protocols/TraverseFilter.html#/s:3Bow14T.name: traverseFilter(_:_:)
Protocols/TraverseFilter.html#/s:3Bow14T.abstract: A combined traverse and filter operation. Filtering is handled using Option instead of Bool so that the output can be different than the input type.

Protocols/Traverse.html#/s:3Bow8Traverse.name: traverse(_:_:)
Protocols/Traverse.html#/s:3Bow8Traverse.abstract: Maps each element of a structure to an effect, evaluates them from left to right and collects the results.

Protocols/Traverse.html#/s:3Bow8Traverse.name: sequence(_:)
Protocols/Traverse.html#/s:3Bow8Traverse.abstract: Evaluate each effect in a structure of values and collects the results.

Protocols/Traverse.html#/s:3Bow8Traverse.name: flatTraverse(_:_:)
Protocols/Traverse.html#/s:3Bow8Traverse.abstract: A traverse followed by flattening the inner result.

Protocols/SemigroupK.html#/s:3Bow10Semig.name: combineK(_:_:)
Protocols/SemigroupK.html#/s:3Bow10Semig.abstract: Combines two values of the same type in the context implementing this instance.

Protocols/Semigroup.html#/s:3Bow9Semigro.name: combine(_:)
Protocols/Semigroup.html#/s:3Bow9Semigro.abstract: An associative operation to combine values of the implementing type.

Protocols/Semigroup.html#/s:3Bow9Semigro.name: combine(_:_:)
Protocols/Semigroup.html#/s:3Bow9Semigro.abstract: Combines two values of the implementing type.

Protocols/Semigroup.html#/s:3Bow9Semigro.name: combineAll(_:)
Protocols/Semigroup.html#/s:3Bow9Semigro.abstract: Combines a variable number of values of the implementing type, in the order provided in the call.

Protocols/Semigroup.html#/s:3Bow9Semigro.name: combineAll(_:)
Protocols/Semigroup.html#/s:3Bow9Semigro.abstract: Combines an array of values of the implementing type, in the order provided in the call.

Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.name: select(_:_:)
Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.abstract: Conditionally applies the second computation based on the result of the first.

Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.name: whenS(_:_:)
Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.abstract: Evaluates the second computation when the first evaluates to true.

Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.name: branch(_:_:_:)
Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.abstract: Evaluates one out of two computations based on the result of another computation.

Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.name: ifS(_:_:_:)
Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.abstract: Evaluates one out of two computations based on the result of another computation.

Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.name: orS(_:_:)
Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.abstract: A lifted version of lazy boolean or.

Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.name: andS(_:_:)
Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.abstract: A lifted version of lazy boolean and.

Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.name: fromOptionS(_:_:)
Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.abstract: Evaluates an optional computation, providing a default value for the empty case.

Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.name: anyS(_:_:)
Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.abstract: A lifted version of any. Retains the short-circuiting behavior.

Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.name: allS(_:_:)
Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.abstract: A lifted version of all. Retains the short-circuiting behavior.

Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.name: whileS(_:)
Protocols/Selective.html#/s:3Bow9Selecti.abstract: Evaluates a computation as long as it evaluates to true.

Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.name: reduceLeftTo(_:_:_:)
Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.abstract: Eagerly reduces a structure of values from left to right, also performing a transformation of values.

Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.name: reduceRightTo(_:_:_:)
Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.abstract: Lazily reduces a structure of values from right to left, also performing a transformation of values.

Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.name: reduceLeft(_:_:)
Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.abstract: Eagerly reduces a structure of values from left to right without transforming them.

Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.name: reduceRight(_:_:)
Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.abstract: Lazily reduces a structure of values from right to left without transforming them.

Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.name: reduceLeftToOption(_:_:_:)
Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.abstract: Reduces the elements of a structure down to a single value by applying the provided transformation and aggregation funtions in a left-associative manner.

Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.name: reduceRightToOption(_:_:_:)
Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.abstract: Reduces the elements of a structure down to a single value by applying the provided transformation and aggregation functions in a right-associative manner.

Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.name: isEmpty(_:)
Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.abstract: Checks if a structure of values is empty.

Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.name: nonEmpty(_:)
Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.abstract: Checks if a structure of values is not empty.

Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.name: reduce(_:)
Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.abstract: Reduces a structure of values to a summary value using the combination capabilities of the Semigroup instance of the underlying type.

Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.name: reduceMap(_:_:)
Protocols/Reducible.html#/s:3Bow9Reducib.abstract: Reduces a structure of values by mapping them to a type with a Semigroup instance, and using its combination capabilities.

Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html#/s:3Bow.name: split(_:)
Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html#/s:3Bow.abstract: Divides a structure of values into a tuple that represents the first value of the structure (first component of the tuple) and the rest of values of the structure (second component of the tuple)

Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html#/s:3Bow.name: fold(_:)
Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html#/s:3Bow.abstract: Folds a structure of values provided that its type has an instance of Monoid.

Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html#/s:3Bow.name: find(_:_:)
Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html#/s:3Bow.abstract: Looks for an element that matches a given predicate.

Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html#/s:3Bow.name: exists(_:_:)
Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html#/s:3Bow.abstract: Checks if any element in a structure matches a given predicate.

Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html#/s:3Bow.name: forall(_:_:)
Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html#/s:3Bow.abstract: Checks if all elements in a structure match a given predicate.

Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html#/s:3Bow.name: count(_:)
Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html#/s:3Bow.abstract: Counts how many elements a structure contains.

Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html#/s:3Bow.name: get(_:_:)
Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html#/s:3Bow.abstract: Obtains a specific element of a structure of elements given its indexed position.

Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html#/s:3Bow.name: foldM(_:_:_:)
Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html#/s:3Bow.abstract: Performs a monadic left fold from the source context to the target monad.

Protocols/MonadWriter.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.name: W
Protocols/MonadWriter.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.abstract: Type of the side stream of data produced by this monad

Protocols/MonadWriter.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.name: listen(_:)
Protocols/MonadWriter.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.abstract: Adds the side stream of data to the result of a computation.

Protocols/MonadWriter.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.name: pass(_:)
Protocols/MonadWriter.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.abstract: Performs a computation and transforms the side stream of data.

Protocols/MonadWriter.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.name: tell(_:)
Protocols/MonadWriter.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.abstract: Produces a new value of the side stream of data.

Protocols/MonadWriter.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.name: listens(_:_:)
Protocols/MonadWriter.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.abstract: Performs a computation and transforms the side stream of data, pairing it with the result of the computation.

Protocols/MonadWriter.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.name: censor(_:_:)
Protocols/MonadWriter.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.abstract: Transforms the side stream of data of a given computation.

Protocols/MonadState.html#/s:3Bow10Monad.name: S
Protocols/MonadState.html#/s:3Bow10Monad.abstract: Type of the state maintained in this instance

Protocols/MonadState.html#/s:3Bow10Monad.name: get()
Protocols/MonadState.html#/s:3Bow10Monad.abstract: Retrieves the state from the internals of the monad.

Protocols/MonadState.html#/s:3Bow10Monad.name: state(_:)
Protocols/MonadState.html#/s:3Bow10Monad.abstract: Embeds a state action into the monad.

Protocols/MonadState.html#/s:3Bow10Monad.name: inspect(_:)
Protocols/MonadState.html#/s:3Bow10Monad.abstract: Retrieves a specific component of the state.

Protocols/MonadReader.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.name: local(_:_:)
Protocols/MonadReader.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.abstract: Executes a computation in a modified environment.

Protocols/MonadReader.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.name: reader(_:)
Protocols/MonadReader.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.abstract: Retrieves a function of the current environment.

Protocols/MonadFilter.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.name: empty()
Protocols/MonadFilter.html#/s:3Bow11Mona.abstract: Obtains an empty element in the context implementing this instance.

Protocols/MonadError.html#/s:3Bow10Monad.name: ensure(_:_:_:)
Protocols/MonadError.html#/s:3Bow10Monad.abstract: Checks if the value of a computation matches a predicate, raising an error if not.

Protocols/MonadCombine.html#/s:3Bow12Mon.name: unite(_:)
Protocols/MonadCombine.html#/s:3Bow12Mon.abstract: Fold over the inner structure to combine all of the values with our combine method inherited from `MonoidK.

Protocols/Monad.html#/s:3Bow5MonadP7flat.name: flatMap(_:_:)
Protocols/Monad.html#/s:3Bow5MonadP7flat.abstract: Sequentially compose two computations, passing any value produced by the first as an argument to the second.

Protocols/Monad.html#/s:3Bow5MonadPAAE7f.name: flatten(_:)
Protocols/Monad.html#/s:3Bow5MonadPAAE7f.abstract: Flattens a nested structure of the context implementing this instance into a single layer.

Protocols/Monad.html#/s:3Bow5MonadPAAE10.name: followedBy(_:_:)
Protocols/Monad.html#/s:3Bow5MonadPAAE10.abstract: Sequentially compose two computations, discarding the value produced by the first.

Protocols/Monad.html#/s:3Bow5MonadPAAE14.name: followedByEval(_:_:)

Protocols/AutoGetter.html.name: AutoGetter
Protocols/AutoGetter.html.abstract: Protocol for automatic derivation of Getter optics

Protocols/AutoOptional.html.name: AutoOptional
Protocols/AutoOptional.html.abstract: Protocol for automatic derivation of Optional optics.

Protocols/AutoPrism.html.name: AutoPrism
Protocols/AutoPrism.html.abstract: Protocol for automatic derivation of Prism optics.

Protocols/At.html.name: At
Protocols/At.html.abstract: At provides a Lens for a this structure to focus at AtFoci at a given index AtIndex.

Protocols/Cons.html.name: Cons
Protocols/Cons.html.abstract: Cons provides a Prism between this structure and a pair containing its first element and its tail. It provides a convenient way to attach or detach elements to the left side of a structure.

Protocols/Each.html.name: Each
Protocols/Each.html.abstract: Each provides a Traversal that can focus into this structure to see all its foci of type EachFoci.

Protocols/FilterIndex.html.name: FilterIndex
Protocols/FilterIndex.html.abstract: FilterIndex provides a Traversal for this structure with all its foci FilterIndexFoci whose index FilterIndexType satisfies a predicate.

Protocols/Index.html.name: Index
Protocols/Index.html.abstract: Index provides an Optional for this structure to focus on an optional IndexFoci at a given index IndexType.

Protocols/Snoc.html.name: Snoc
Protocols/Snoc.html.abstract: Snoc defines a Prism between this structure and its init (all elements but the last one) and last elements. It can be seen as the reverse of Cons. It provides a way to attach or detach elements on the end side of a structure.

Protocols/Functor.html.name: Functor
Protocols/Functor.html.abstract: A Functor provides a type with the ability to transform its value type into another type, while preserving its structure.

Protocols/Applicative.html.name: Applicative
Protocols/Applicative.html.abstract: An Applicative Functor is a Functor that also provides functionality to lift pure expressions, and sequence computations and combine their results.

Protocols/ApplicativeError.html.name: ApplicativeError
Protocols/ApplicativeError.html.abstract: An ApplicativeError is an Applicative that has capabilities to raise and handle error values.

Protocols.html#/s:3Bow7BimonadP.name: Bimonad
Protocols.html#/s:3Bow7BimonadP.abstract: A Bimonad has the same capabilities as Monad and Comonad.

Protocols/Comonad.html.name: Comonad
Protocols/Comonad.html.abstract: A Comonad is the dual of a Monad. It provides capabilities to compose functions that extract values from their context.

Protocols/Contravariant.html.name: Contravariant
Protocols/Contravariant.html.abstract: A Contravariant Functor is the dual of a Covariant Functor, usually referred to as just Functor. Whereas an intuition behind Covariant Functors is that they can be seen as containing or producing values, Contravariant Functors can be seen as consuming values.

Protocols/EquatableK.html.name: EquatableK
Protocols/EquatableK.html.abstract: EquatableK provides capabilities to check equality of values at the kind level.

Protocols/Foldable.html.name: Foldable
Protocols/Foldable.html.abstract: Foldable describes types that have the ability to be folded to a summary value.

Protocols/FunctorFilter.html.name: FunctorFilter
Protocols/FunctorFilter.html.abstract: A FunctorFilter provides the same capabilities as a Functor, while filtering out elements simultaneously.

Protocols/Invariant.html.name: Invariant
Protocols/Invariant.html.abstract: An Invariant Functor provides a type the ability to transform its value type into another type. An instance of Functor or Contravariant are Invariant Functors as well.

Protocols/Monad.html.name: Monad
Protocols/Monad.html.abstract: A Monad provides functionality to sequence operations that are dependent from one another.

Protocols/MonadCombine.html.name: MonadCombine
Protocols/MonadCombine.html.abstract: A MonadCombine has the capabilities of MonadFilter and Alternative together.

Protocols/MonadError.html.name: MonadError
Protocols/MonadError.html.abstract: A MonadError has the same capabilities as a Monad and an ApplicativeError.

Protocols/MonadFilter.html.name: MonadFilter
Protocols/MonadFilter.html.abstract: A MonadFilter is a Monad with FunctorFilter capabilities. It also provides functionality to create a value that represents an empty element in the context implementing an instance of this typeclass.

Protocols/MonadReader.html.name: MonadReader
Protocols/MonadReader.html.abstract: A MonadReader is a Monad with capabilities to read values from a shared environment.

Protocols/MonadState.html.name: MonadState
Protocols/MonadState.html.abstract: A MonadState is a Monad that maintains a state.

Protocols/MonadWriter.html.name: MonadWriter
Protocols/MonadWriter.html.abstract: A MonadWriter is a Monad with the ability to produce a stream of data in addition to the computed values.

Protocols/Monoid.html.name: Monoid
Protocols/Monoid.html.abstract: A monoid is an algebraic structure that has the same properties as a semigroup, with an empty element.

Protocols/MonoidK.html.name: MonoidK
Protocols/MonoidK.html.abstract: A MonoidK is a SemigroupK that also has an empty element.

Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html.name: NonEmptyReducible
Protocols/NonEmptyReducible.html.abstract: NonEmptyReducible defines a Reducible in terms of another type that has an instance of Foldable and a method that is able to split a structure of values in a first value and the rest of the values in the structure.

Protocols/Reducible.html.name: Reducible
Protocols/Reducible.html.abstract: Reducible augments the functions provided by Foldable with reducing functions that do not need an initial value.

Protocols/Selective.html.name: Selective
Protocols/Selective.html.abstract: The Selective typeclass represents Selective Applicative Functors, described in this paper. Selective Applicative Functors enrich Applicative Functors by providing an operation that composes two effectful computations where the second depends on the first.

Protocols/Semigroup.html.name: Semigroup
Protocols/Semigroup.html.abstract: A semigroup is an algebraic structure that consists of a set of values and an associative operation.

Protocols/SemigroupK.html.name: SemigroupK
Protocols/SemigroupK.html.abstract: SemigroupK is a Semigroup that operates on kinds with one type parameter.

Protocols/Traverse.html.name: Traverse
Protocols/Traverse.html.abstract: Traverse provides a type with the ability to traverse a structure with an effect.

Protocols/TraverseFilter.html.name: TraverseFilter
Protocols/TraverseFilter.html.abstract: TraverseFilter represents array-like structures that can be traversed and filtered as a single combined operation. It provides the same capabilities as Traverse and FunctorFilter together.

Classes/BoundSetter.html#/s:9BowOptics11.name: set(_:)

Classes/BoundSetter.html.name: BoundSetter
Classes/BoundSetter.html.abstract: A BoundSetter is a Setter that is already bound to a concrete source.

Classes/Getter.html.name: Getter
Classes/Getter.html.abstract: A Getter is an optic that allows to see into a structure and getting a focus.

Classes/Fold.html.name: Fold
Classes/Fold.html.abstract: A Fold is an optic that allows to focus into a structure and get multiple results.

Classes/Kind.html.name: Kind
Classes/Kind.html.abstract: Simulates a Higher-Kinded Type in Swift with 1 type argument.

Classes/ArrayK.html.name: ArrayK
Classes/ArrayK.html.abstract: ArrayK is a Higher Kinded Type wrapper over Swift arrays.

Classes/Const.html.name: Const
Classes/Const.html.abstract: Constant data type. Represents a container of two types, holding a value of the left type that remains constant, regardless of the transformation applied to it.

Classes/EitherK.html.name: EitherK
Classes/EitherK.html.abstract: EitherK is a sum type for kinds. Represents a type where you can hold either a Kind<F, A> or a Kind<G, A>.

Classes/Either.html.name: Either
Classes/Either.html.abstract: Sum type of types A and B. Represents a value of either one of those types, but not both at the same time. Values of type A are called left; values of type B are called right.

Classes/Id.html.name: Id
Classes/Id.html.abstract: The identity data type represents a context of having no effect on the type it wraps. A instance of Id<A> is isomorphic to an instance of A; it is just wrapped without any additional information.

Classes/Ior.html.name: Ior
Classes/Ior.html.abstract: Ior represents an inclusive-or of two different types. It may have a value of the left type, the right type or both at the same time.

Classes/NonEmptyArray.html.name: NonEmptyArray
Classes/NonEmptyArray.html.abstract: A NonEmptyArray is an array of elements that guarantees to have at least one element.

Classes/Option.html.name: Option
Classes/Option.html.abstract: Represents optional values. Instances of this type may represent the presence of a value (some) or absence of it (none). This type is isomorphic to native Swift Optional<A> (usually written A?), with the addition of behaving as a Higher Kinded Type.

Classes/Try.html.name: Try
Classes/Try.html.abstract: Describes the result of an operation that may have thrown errors or succeeded. The type parameter corresponds to the result type of the operation.

Classes/Validated.html.name: Validated
Classes/Validated.html.abstract: Validated is a data type to represent valid and invalid values. It is similar to Either, but with error accumulation in the invalid case.

Classes.html#/s:9BowOptics7ForPIsoC.name: ForPIso
Classes.html#/s:9BowOptics7ForPIsoC.abstract: Witness for the PIso<S, T, A, B> data type. To be used in simulated Higher Kinded Types.

Classes/PIso.html.name: PIso
Classes/PIso.html.abstract: An Iso is a loss less invertible optic that defines an isomorphism between a type S and A.

Classes/PLens.html.name: PLens
Classes/PLens.html.abstract: A Lens (or Functional Reference) is an optic that can focus into a structure for getting, setting or modifying the focus (target).

Classes/PPrism.html.name: PPrism
Classes/PPrism.html.abstract: A Prism is a loss less invertible optic that can look into a structure and optionally find its focus. It is mostly used for finding a focus that is only present under certain conditions, like in a sum type.
